= Usage with Maven or sbt =

It is advised to use Maven or sbt to manage dependencies automatically.
  * Download JARs : [http://code.google.com/p/bridj/downloads/list Downloads Section] or [http://nativelibs4java.sourceforge.net/maven/com/nativelibs4java/bridj/ Binary snapshots]
  * Use with Maven :
{{{
<repositories>
  <repository>
    <id>nativelibs4java-repo</id>
    <url>http://nativelibs4java.sourceforge.net/maven</url>
  </repository>
</repositories>
<dependencies>
  <dependency>
	<groupId>com.nativelibs4java</groupId>
	<artifactId>bridj</artifactId>
	<version>0.4.2</version>
	<scope>compile</scope>
  </dependency>
</dependencies>
}}}
  * Use with sbt :
{{{
import sbt._

class Project(info: ProjectInfo) extends DefaultProject(info)
{
  val nativelibs4javaRepo = "NativeLibs4Java Repository" at "http://nativelibs4java.sourceforge.net/maven/"
  val bridj = "com.nativelibs4java" % "bridj" % "0.4.2"
}
}}}

== Smaller specialized versions ==

= Platform notes =

== Windows ==

COM is support is ok.

.NET support is non-existent.

== MacOS X ==

Objective-C support is dramatically undertested and probably very poor. Help would be appreciated...

== Android ==

[http://code.google.com/p/nativelibs4java/issues/detail?id=69 BridJ support for Android is on its way] with some reports of success.

== iOS (jailbroken iPhones and iPads) ==

BridJ's support for iOS is not working properly yet, and relies on [http://jamvm.sourceforge.net/ JamVM].
